title: How to Make Bolu Kojo

parts.name: Warming the butter and coconut milk

steps.headline: Melt the margarine over medium high heat.
steps.description: Remove from the heat and pour into a bowl.

steps.headline: Pour the coconut milk into another pan.
steps.description: Heat, stirring frequently and slowly. Do not let it curdle.

steps.headline: Add 2 eggs to the mixing bowl Whisk well until smooth.
Pour in the heated coconut milk.
Add the food coloring.
steps.description: Stir until it is evenly distributed throughout the cake batter.

steps.headline: Pour the batter slowly into the cake pan.
Steam the cake until cooked.
steps.description: Check the cake occasionally by sticking a toothpick or skewer into the cake. If it comes out clean, the cake is done.

steps.headline: After the cake has steamed, slice and serve it hot.
steps.description: The bolu kojo is ready to eat!

text: Warming the butter and coconut milk Melt the margarine over medium high heat. Remove from the heat and pour into a bowl. Pour the coconut milk into another pan. Heat, stirring frequently and slowly. Do not let it curdle. Making the cake batter Add 2 eggs to the mixing bowl Whisk well until smooth.  Add sugar little by little. Stir occasionally. Add the flour. Stir the batter until smooth. Pour in the heated coconut milk. Stir well Pour in the melted margarine.  Add the food coloring. Stir until it is evenly distributed throughout the cake batter. Pour the batter slowly into the cake pan.  Steam the cake until cooked. Check the cake occasionally by sticking a toothpick or skewer into the cake. If it comes out clean, the cake is done. After the cake has steamed, slice and serve it hot. The bolu kojo is ready to eat!
